text: I worked nearby back in 2016, and had the chicken chop at least once a week. The chicken was good, suspect he put abit of  Kentucky-style powder on it before grilling it. Portion was super huge too for the price. I came back recently (2024) hoping to enjoy the chicken chop again. It tasted different to me this time. I couldn’t sleep that night wondering if it was the chicken chop that changed, or was it me. I know the sauce definitely changed (the new black pepper sauce was very overpowering) but I’m not sure about the chicken. The portioning is still huge though. Please let me know if you have a similar thought or experience too.

Big food court, non aircon and limited parking space, park mostly along the road.
Many different variety of dish at economy rice stall, generous portion, delicious, affordable and friendly staff 👍
Many stalls available, mix vegetables, sliced fish soup, western, China food, yong tau fu, claypot soup, india food. Large place to accommodate. And there is a new india barber shop just outside.

So far the best yet around Tuas. The variety and great food too! recommended The ban mian fish soup its delicious! Vary from others i taste! The mixed rice wow 😍 the varieties 😋 with the generous portion very rare but a good mix with friendly staff 👍 but most of all. The price. Is mind blowing! Very reasonable and some unreasonably cheap 😂 don't believe me? Try the western food then u know wat i mean 😍

Ill start with negative.
The coffee lady selling Kopi is very rude. The coffee is mediocre at best.

Then I eat at Al-Dia.
The food is so-so, But the price is expensive compare to what I had from other places.

But the atmosphere here is very nice. spacious ang full of colours.
